result.execSummary:
All charges against Shannon Anthony Johnson in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shannon Anthony Johnson is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shannon Anthony Johnson

Defendant Shannon Anthony Johnson in court.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a preliminary hearing.  State's witness is not available. State is requesting an adjournment.  Defense is moving to dismiss.  Court ordered case dismissed without prejudice.

Defendant Shannon Anthony Johnson in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Shannon Anthony Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a Preliminary Hearing.  State's witness is not available and is requesting and adjournment.  Defense objects.  Court granted motion to adjourn.  Case is adjourned to 10-12-22 at 8:30 am for preliminary hearing in Br. 10.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shannon Anthony Johnson in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for order to show cause hearing. Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Defense counsel was recently appointed, and is requesting case be set for a Preliminary Hearing. Case adjourned to Br 10. This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Shannon Anthony Johnson in court.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.  Case in court for status of counsel.  The Public Defender's Office has not appointed counsel.  Court set matter for an order to show cause hearing. This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:

Defendant Shannon Anthony Johnson in court.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  No attorney has been appointed yet.  Case is adjourned to 7-18-22 at 8:30 am for status of counsel.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Shannon Anthony Johnson in court.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shannon Anthony Johnson appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Matter scheduled for Preliminary Hearing.  Public defenders office has not appointed counsel at this time.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.  Status conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Shannon Anthony Johnson in court with attorney Robert W Peterson.  Defendant Shannon Anthony Johnson in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Shannon Anthony Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Case is adjourned to Br. PE for Branch 10 .  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with N.A.D.; C.M.L; S.S.S.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
